Hey everyone :) 

It's been a long time since I've played Nwn cause I wanted to take a break and I'm back and I wanna try something new.I would like to play a pure spellcasting build probably wizard cause I've tried sorcerer.The thing is that I have no idea how to build it cause I've never built one xD 
Do I have to go Wizard 40 ?? I mean I don't want any weapon focus or any weapon at all just spellcasting.Also the build that I liked the most was exalted sorceress,That build was just Amazing I loved the way it was built sooo have in mind something like that but as a Wizard.

So onto the guidelines
1)PvP based 
2)Level cap is 40
3)Human if possible but is debatable if it's to gain power 
4)Wizard all the way some other class levels just for skills if needed
5)I'm looking for strong offensive spells,I like necromancy the most

Also if we could make the exalted sorceress playable (just some tweaks I guess) I might be happy to play that instead of trying to make a new build 
I play on the server The three towns so not many changes just that you can't cast while in expertise or improved expertise and that you can stack mestils acid sheath death armor etc.
Also A caster gains +1 to spell DCs for every 2 levels past 20 in their casting class
so thtas the reason to go Wiz40 but I guess 38 would be fine too
(maybe more but I can't remember right now)
So that is all I wait for your feedback and try to work out something that I like :) Peace out !

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
The ol' junk dealin' PW, eh?  Still pretty active for a vanilla server, I see.  (It is still vanilla, isn't it?)

A hi-CON gnomish Wiz 39/mnk 1 is probably what will PvP best.  Naturally, you can add another pre-epic dump (i.e. wiz 38/mnk 2) just to make leveling a bit easier but I wouldn't dilute your arcane prowess any further than that... not for PvP.

One question, having only ever played cleric hybrids and shifters on 3T... do they use a standard Craft Wand rule or a custom one?  That feat can make your dungeon crawls much easier for a purish wiz but gets expensive if they use the normal charges based on level and default caster level of the finished wand.

One synergy you may decide to pursue is Wiz/rog instead of the monk dump if you are into traps.  I remember 3T not having too many traps to recover, though... unless they've changed it.  With all the INT, you could easily build an epic wiz that just happens to be able to spot, recover and set epic traps.  Other than as a trapper, though, there really isn't any natural synergy like src/pal or src/BG.  For a wiz, Spellcraft will be uber and make it easier to counterspell than a src all the way through the early and mid levels.  They won't have the high universal saves of the exalted but will make up for much of that weakness vs. spells. 

However, vs. DevCritters, you'll be needing PM 10 or else settle for a melee mage Iron Golem and pray they don't have Divine Might to pierce your Epic Warding.  As I've repeated many times, you need to decide the sort of dueling opponent before building.  There's no such thing as an all-purpose PvP build for any class.  It will always have at least one major weakness that can be exploited by anyone who owns the counter.

The epic trapper version is essentially the same, just with skills more biased towards managing epic and PvP traps.

The reason for ignoring epic spell focus is that it only yields a 1 DC loss on the focused schools but gains 1 DC for all other schools (i.e. 2x Grt INT instead of focus feats), especially the Enchantment school which is extremely effective vs. high Fort/low Will types that can otherwise shrug off most Necro spells.
